programme.title: FREAKY FRIDAY
programme.desc: Horror/Thriller Movies

programme.title: Green Room (2015)
programme.desc: A punk rock band is forced to fight for survival after witnessing a murder at a neo-Nazi skinhead bar

programme.title: Crawl (2019)
programme.desc: A young woman, while attempting to save her father during a category 5 hurricane, finds herself trapped in a flooding house and must fight for her life against alligators

programme.title: 30 Days of Night (2007)
programme.desc: After an Alaskan town is plunged into darkness for a month, it is attacked by a bloodthirsty gang of vampires

programme.title: It Follows (2014)
programme.desc: A young woman is followed by an unknown supernatural force after a sexual encounter

programme.title: Cars (2006)
programme.desc: A hot-shot race-car named Lightning McQueen gets waylaid in Radiator Springs, where he finds the true meaning of friendship and family

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: A young Peruvian bear travels to London in search of a home. Finding himself lost and alone at Paddington Station, he meets the kindly Brown family, who offer him a temporary haven

programme.title: Juno (2007)
programme.desc: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual decision regarding her unborn child

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Hundreds of sub-postmasters were jailed or financially ruined after computers said money was missing from their branches, but the Post Office has admitted that its Horizon system can make mistakes. But when did senior managers find this out, and did they continue to prosecute postmasters for stealing when they knew technology could be to blame? Reporter Nick Wallis investigates what could be Britain's biggest-ever miscarriage of justice scandal and uncovers evidence of a cover-up at the Post Office.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Joe Swift shows how to bring a lawn back to life, AJ Rose demonstrates how easy it is to put down decking, and Jay has a tip to help keep tools tidy.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Anu and Ash live in Coventry with their cat Quinn, where their garden is currently a new build blank canvas divided into two cramped tiers. The couple want to turn it into a pet-friendly delight, inspired by the gardens and countryside they fell in love with on holidays in Tuscany, Italy. They want lots of interest for Quinn and a large inviting patio where they can entertain their friends and family. Arit Anderson and Charlie Dimmock have a £3,500 budget to make the couple's dreams come true.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift celebrate the positive power of plants as they focus on the designers and growers striving for a better world with the creations they bring to the event. They reveal how, over the years, the show has contributed to the better promotion of the health of the planet, plants and people, and talk to Countryfile presenter Ellie Harrison and BBC correspondent Fergal Keane about the importance of gardens to mental wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament.(n)

programme.title: Sacred Wonders of Britain
programme.desc: Neil Oliver travels to Iona in the Inner Hebrides to learn about St Columba's tough brand of monasticism, and finds out how the epic journey of St Cuthbert led to the writing of the Lindisfarne Gospels and the building of Durham Cathedral. At Canterbury Cathedral, Neil discovers how the gruesome murder of Thomas Becket spurred the building of its nave, and on Glastonbury Tor in Somerset, he investigates the story of the Holy Grail, the sacred cup of everlasting life.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Dan Walker hosts the strategic game show in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen go on a culinary journey around the nation, following a route mapped out by the adventurous gourmand Samuel Chamberlain in his 1963 travelogue British Bouquet: An Epicurean Tour of Britain. They begin in the Dorset seaside town of Weymouth, where they sample lots of fresh seafood before heading to the countryside to eat Portland lamb.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Yugoslavia v Spain. A chance to see the Euro 2000 Group C encounter at Jan Breydel Stadium in Bruges, Belgium.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott and Len Goodman head to Bradford, where the Strictly Come Dancing judge has his first taste of a Pakistani curry and samples some Latvian cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Claire Rawle and James Lewis value antiques and collectibles at St Albans Cathedral and Abbey in Hertfordshire, while Paul Martin visits nearby Knebworth House.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble revisit dramatic events at Longleat. Kate visits the red panda maternity suite, Alfie the gorilla has surgery to address a recurring infection on his jaw, and the park goes into lockdown after reports of an escaped animal. Back in Animal Adventure, Jean Johansson checks in with keeper Kim and Orville the corn snake.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family give up their 21st century technology and travel back in time to discover the radical transformation of our leisure time since 1950. Guided by presenter Giles Coren and social historian Polly Russell, the family's experience is underpinned by The Family Expenditure Survey, a government study which ran from the 1950s through to 1999. In the first episode, dad Rob finds out that he's expected to be handy with a tool kit, while mum Steph comes to terms with all the washing, cooking and cleaning expected of a 1950s housewife. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Daisy learns ballroom dancing courtesy of Angela Rippon, and 12-year-old Seth discovers the great outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with workers at the Walkers Crisps factory in Leicester, which he visited in 2016, finding out how they are coping during the coronavirus crisis. He speaks to manager Carl Lewis, who reveals that in order to keep up with demand they're making big changes to their output, switching away from single packets to a situation where 90 per cent of production is now the multipacks sold in supermarkets.(n)

programme.title: Inside Monaco: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix narrates a documentary giving an insight into the principality on the French Riviera, with access to the royal palace as well as the super-rich and those who serve them. In the first edition, director Michael Waldman explores how this extraordinary country operates, meeting everyone from Prince Albert and his staff to wealthy widow Monika Bacardi, who takes him on a tour in her chauffeur-driven classic Rolls-Royce. He also goes track side with ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard and team owner Eddie Jordan during the Monaco Grand Prix.(n)

programme.title: Comedians: Home Alone
programme.desc: Vic Reeves does his inimitable impersonation of Graham Norton, Sara Pascoe teaches yoga with her rescue dog, Reginald D Hunter gives his unique insight into conspiracy theories and Matt Berry showcases his exclusive anti-virus song. Also featuring Bob Mortimer, Tony Way, Adam Buxton and some very relaxed cats.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons join regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at the news. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven is at home in his garden, where he gives tips on what butterflies to look out for and how to get involved in a nationwide survey. He also catches up with NHS fundraiser Tom Moore to discover what role the countryside has played in his life. Shepherdess Hannah Jackson puts her two new collie pups through their first paces as working dogs, and Adam Henson turns teacher as he takes his piglets to the country's home-schooled children.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A boy taking part in a karting race is sent flying into the air as his father watches from the stands, and a man who dived into a river to save a dog needs rescuing as well.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and the team look at the legends and legacies that have made the Chelsea Flower Show the greatest event in the horticultural calendar. They discover what it takes to become an icon at this show, talk to the Chelsea designers and plants men and women that have broken records, won global recognition and inspired generations of gardeners. Plus, how movers and shakers from other creative fields have been influenced by their visits to the event over the years.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Documentary following a mentorship scheme designed to help new nurses stay in the profession and reverse a trend in which more than a third are looking for new roles. Newly qualified nurse Lauren has reached breaking point in one of the busiest A&E departments in the UK, so mentor Taz tries to negotiates an urgent move for her to a new part of the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly International Antiques and Collectors Fair in West Sussex, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits a windmill that has been turned into a museum of rural life.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms - and the memories they hold - back to life, tackling a 1960s cine-projector, a wicker chair and a hand-crafted spinning wheel that has travelled all the way from Shetland.(n)

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: In the ancient market town of Devizes, Terry Wogan and cabbie Mason McQueen are on the hunt for the finest flavours in town. They sample local foods including the famous Wiltshire cured bacon, and navigating the famous Calne locks helps them appreciate a home-made bread and butter pudding.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Ukraine v Northern Ireland. Another chance to see the Euro 2016 Group C encounter from Parc Olympique Lyonnais in France.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: The pair reach Leicester, where Len Goodman braves his first ever Indian curry and samples a selection of Greek cuisine. Chef Ainsley Harriott heads to the kitchen to create spiced fish cakes, inspired by the day's adventures in the city.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and James Lewis are at Herstmonceux Castle in East Sussex, where a Chinese wall plaque catches James's eye, and Paul Martin explores the history of the building.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Keepers battle to get the rhinos to take a skin soothing mud bath, and the vets must get to the root of Arabella the South East Asian binturong's anger issues.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family sample life in the 1960s and with more money to go around, there's more fun to be had, including a trip to the seaside, a Dansette record player for 16-year-old Daisy and even their own Mini to enjoy. Dad Rob and son Seth take on football legend Trevor Brooking for a game of Subbuteo in the dining room, and Daisy and mum Steph meet Sandie Shaw to discover how the decade's daring fashions reflected the growing freedoms and confidence enjoyed by the younger generation.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke present the latest updates from the cameras set up across the country, including a portrait of the Lake District. Ecologist Ellie Harrison shares wildlife stories live from her home in the Cotswolds, and nature cameraman Raymond Besant encounters otters in the Orkney Islands.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga explores the house's history from the 1880s to the First World War, a period that saw the property sliding down the social scale and turning from a family home to a multiple occupancy. He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever.(n)

programme.title: I'll Get This - Extra Helping
programme.desc: Tom Davis, Julian Clary, Laura Whitmore, Rachel Johnson and Chris Kamara meet at a restaurant for a fancy meal. The catch is they'll play games between courses and the loser will have to pay for everyone's dinner.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: House of Saud: A Family at War
programme.desc: Documentary following Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who has pledged to transform the country. Cameras examine the new leader's dramatic commitment to end extremism and to return to moderate Islam. Travelling from Eastern Europe to India, and across the bloody battlefields of Syria and Yemen, it traces the impact that huge amounts of Saudi cash and weapons have had around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the eight remaining contestants take part in a series of challenges as they return to the sewing room for lingerie and sleepwear week. To test the sewers' handling skills, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kick off the pattern challenge with a boned basque. The task requires sewing together small pattern pieces for a precise fit and creating a tricky hook and eye fastening. Next, in the transformation challenge, the sewers transform pyjamas and nightwear into a summer dress, before finally being tasked to create a two-piece female sleep set which has to incorporates lace somewhere in their design.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: George Anderson hankers after hostas, Kirsty Wilson harks back to the '70s to create an easy terrarium and Chris Beardshaw deals with a very bad bout of Box Blight.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Two divers documenting a wreck in the Thames find more than they bargained for and call in the Royal Navy bomb team. An unsafe load on a vehicle flies off, landing on a windscreen.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: A new midwife questions whether she is cut out for her vocation when she fails to master a vital technique - but her mentor has a plan to help her perfect her skills.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Visitors try to get a good deal on an unusual key, a harmonica, an early 20th-century underwear advert, and a Victorian silver belt. Nigel Havers presents.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality renovations for a couple's home in Margate. The property was originally a B&B, and the transition to a home has not been entirely successful. It is poorly laid out, has too many rooms, and while big on floor space is lacking natural light. Laura sets out to return the building to its early 20th-century roots, whole Robert comes up with a radically different way of using the living space.(n)

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen embark on the third leg of the tour around Britain, following Samuel Chamberlain's 1963 travelogue British Bouquet: An Epicurean Tour of Britain. Arriving in York, they sample one of the city's signature hams, and the confusingly named savoury duck, before heading to Ampleforth for more culinary treats. Finally, their visit concludes with a riotous Viking feast, hosted by Eric the Red.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Sweden v England. A chance to see the Euro 2012 Group D encounter at the Olympic Stadium in Kiev.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman has his first taste of Korean barbecue food and samples Swedish cuisine, and Ainsley Harriott cooks a salmon and mango salad inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting Muncaster Castle, the Bowes Museum and Norwich Cathedral. Antiques experts include Kate Bateman, Paul Laidlaw, Jonathan Pratt, James Lewis and Thomas Plant, with items ranging from a pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Vets must try and repair the hands of Maurice and Angelo, two injured ring-tail lemurs. Elsewhere, the keepers are on standby as a seahorse gives birth.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family strut into the 1970s and some discover there were unexpected upsides to the economic and political turmoil the decade is often remembered for. Rob and Steph share more time together, playing darts with Eric Bristow and taking on some period appropriate home improvement. Meanwhile, daughter Daisy lets her hair down at a roller disco with DJ Trevor Nelson, and the family receive a visit from Top Gear's original presenter, Angela Rippon.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Gillian Burke, Iolo Williams and Gordon Buchanan share more seasonal stories from Spring 2020. Iolo shares his own personal stories about the wildflowers growing in his local hedgerows and cameraman Sam Oakes documents the fortunes of two very different long tailed tit nests.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: When a new victim is found, it becomes increasingly clear that the murderer's main targets are not the victims themselves, but their loved ones. Police work to establish a link between the two deaths, but crucial information continues to elude them. Meanwhile, John and Liz grow closer as they focus on the case. Crime thriller, based on the John Cardinal Mysteries series by Canadian author Giles Blunt, starring Billy Campbell, Karine Vanasse, Glen Gould and Kristen Thomson.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: Another abduction hits painfully close to home for Lise, as she and John race against time to save the next victim before it is too late. Crime thriller, based on the John Cardinal Mysteries series by Canadian author GIles Blunt, starring Billy Campbell, Karine Vanasse and Glen Gould.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits some of the most beautiful and remote spots in Britain, meeting the people who live there and discovering more about Scotland's best-kept secrets. In this episode, he visits the low-lying islands that face the full might of the Atlantic Ocean.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events. Presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: House of Saud: A Family at War
programme.desc: How some of the most prominent and richest Saudi royals were caught up in an unprecedented crackdown on corruption. Hundreds of the richest people in the Kingdom, including 11 members of the Royal Family, were kept in a luxurious five-star hotel. The detentions opened the door on a highly secret world of kickbacks and bribes on a monumental scale.(n)

programme.title: The Real Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: The friends go all out to make Susie's birthday a night to remember, and as the celebration begin, Britt is keen to show she still has what it takes by showing off her singing and dancing talents. The senior citizens also head to Chennai, where Zandra is reunited with a friend from 40 years ago and Henry relives some difficult memories of his last overseas broadcast at the city's famous cricket ground. Back in Puducherry, John and Duncan test their fitness by jumping on their bikes, while Paul, revelling in the chaos of the Indian roads, decides to take his mock Indian driving test.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A skier suffers a leg injury in a remote part of the Alps, so her guide tries to carry her to safety on his back. A girl calls 999 when her mum goes into anaphylactic shock.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: A new format of the annual wildlife series in keeping with Covid-19 lockdown conditions, which sees the presenters broadcasting live from locations around the UK. Chris Packham is in the New Forest, Iolo William is in the heart of west Wales, and Gillian Burke is at the Beaver project near her home in Cornwall. In this first episode, they are joined by guest presenter Steve Backshall at his home on the banks of the Thames. Plus, Michaela Strachan calls live from South Africa to present some of her favourite moments from past series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Fabie, a newly qualified nurse, struggles to cope with life in one of the busiest A&E departments, so she is moved to the surgical assessment unit to protect her mental wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes four more people with interesting items to sell, including a doll designed to teach resuscitation, and a collection of dairy artefacts.(n)

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore the Co Down coastline between Belfast and Strangford Lough, along the Ards Peninsula. In Belfast, Adrian road-tests the largest hydraulic crane in the world and helps park a 100-metre-long Dutch cargo ship. Mehreen goes kayaking on Strangford Lough to see how the currents of the UK's largest sea inlet is placing the area at the forefront of renewable energy research. Plus, Helen Skelton tests the waters of the North Channel, one of the most dangerous swims in the world, and local comedian Shane Todd visits a long-established bespoke racing-car factory.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen continue their culinary journey around the nation, with a visit to Evesham in Worcestershire, where they sample a pork pie wedding cake, meet a plum charmer, dine in one of Britain's oldest inns, and attend an asparagus festival.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Netherlands v Czech Republic. A chance to see the Euro 2004 Group D encounter at Estadio Municipal de Aveiro in Portugal.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len Goodman and Ainsley Harriott reach Cardiff, where the Strictly judge has his first taste of spaghetti and samples some German hospitality, and Ainsley cooks an Italian dish.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Capesthorne Hall in Cheshire as hundreds of visitors arrive with their family heirlooms and the experts pick out the best items to go off to auction. Paul also investigates the history of nearby Quarrybank Mill.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A mystery illness has the keepers worried about Kaiser the giraffe, and the whole team is on tenterhooks as the future of the entire herd hangs in the balance.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family embrace the 1980s, where TV and shopping dominated the UK's leisure time. It's also the decade where technology arrives in homes in a significant way. Kids Daisy and Seth are thrilled by the new VCR and home computer, and there's even a pager for mum Steph who's now a shoulder padded businesswoman. When dad Rob is not trying out the kids' CB radio, he's going shopping for a Don Johnson makeover with fashion guru Caryn Franklin.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: On the storm-lashed Cornish coastline, a pair of shags struggle to rear their chicks, while a young female pine marten prepares to rear her young on a remote Scottish peninsular. Plus, there's a moment of magic as the team celebrates the epic beauty of Dartmoor. Presented by Chris Packham, Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the high-brow quiz, asking questions about road, rail and other things beginning with the letter R. Trying to come up with the answers are Alan Davies, Aisling Bea, Cally Beaton and Holly Walsh.(n)

programme.title: The First Team
programme.desc: The team is given a presentation on the rules of sexual conduct and consent, after which Mattie, Benji and Jack head out for the afternoon determined to keep out of trouble. However, a chance supermarket meeting with a woman who wants them to meet her son Stuart leads to an unfortunate misunderstanding. As Stuart threatens to go public with his side of the story, Mattie and the others try to placate him with an all-access visit to the training complex to meet the team. Starring Shaquille Ali-Yebuah, Jack McMullen, Jake Short and Theo Barklem Biggs.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Nadja and Laszlo's new familiar poses problems for an increasingly anxious Guillermo, and the vampires enlist the services of a local necromancer. Return of the comedy, starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak and Natasia Demetriou.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The vampires hold a seance to deal with a ghost infestation, which only leads to a larger ghost infestation. Starring Natasia Demetriou and Kayvan Novak.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emma Barnett.(n)

programme.title: House of Saud: A Family at War
programme.desc: Examining how Saudi Arabia's most revered family stays in power, featuring interviews with those who have worked for Saudi princes. They describe how the wealth allowed lives of privilege and pleasure out of the spotlight. But the growth of social media has meant Saudis are getting increasing insight into the behaviour of their rulers, including their transgressions.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a compilation of some of the most memorable moments from the past 17 series of the business ideas contest, featuring Dragons past and present getting to grips with ingenious inventions and bizarre money-making schemes. The show recalls some of the harshest dismissals, but also the times when entrepreneurs got the chance to make their dream a reality.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay shares creative and money-saving tips and tricks for the home and garden, including how to build a floating desk and upholster an old stool. Plus, Sarah Moore demonstrates a way to recycle old jars, and Monty Don shares a fantastic method of making a raised bed for the garden.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: A nurse who recently arrived in the UK from the Philippines and is facing up to a double challenge - making a career in the NHS and a new life 7,000 miles from home.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a wartime phone being sold for charity, and a cake stand with cakes thrown in. Presented by Nigel Havers.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores British Columbia, discovering how two superpowers nearly came to war over a pig and joining the Royal Canadian Navy to firefight on board the frigate HMCS Regina. He also explores the rich British heritage and colonial past of Victoria - the provincial capital of British Columbia - discovers the origins of the Hudson's Bay Company, helps to carve a 36- foot totem pole and learns how to head off a charging bear.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: On a visit to Kent, Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen head to Canterbury Cathedral to learn how it helped keep hundreds fed during the Second World War. The pair also call in at a train shed that is now home to a flourishing food market, before popping across to Whitstable to sample its lesser-known delicacy of whelks. At Kent's county cricket ground Mason has a go at leather on willow, before everything stops for tea.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Hungary v Portugal. A chance to see the Euro 2016 Group F encounter at Parc Olympique Lyonnais.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott and Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman's road trip takes the pair to south London, where Len has his first taste of Portuguese and Japanese cuisine. Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouth-watering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble revisit dramatic events at Longleat. The wallabies have gone walk about, Jean Johansson meets some poisonous lizards and world class vets come to assist in saving the rhinos from extinction.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family enters the 1990s, a decade where new technology starts to dominate their leisure time. Twelve year-old Seth finally gets his hands on a Game Boy and games console, while the arrival of the internet and a mobile phone marks the start of how many spend their spare time now. Steph and Rob try out line-dancing, and fitness star Mr Motivator puts them through their paces. Tommy Walsh and Linda Barker also turn up to help the family give the house and garden a 90s makeover.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Ellie Harrison reflect on an unprecedented year and nature's power to help people cope with such challenging times. Wildlife sound recordist Gary Moore searches for a 'lost' dawn chorus on the Knepp Estate in West Sussex, where numbers of rare songbirds like the nightingale are beginning to recover. Gillian Burke explains how she has been helping with a survey of one of Cornwall's much-loved mammals, the grey seal.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don makes space in the writing garden for plants that will flower later in the season and plants out tender vegetables for late summer harvests. Cameras revisit Frances Tophill's allotment to join her as she demonstrates an unusual method of reducing weeds and also catch up with a gardener in Wales who has dedicated years to breeding some very special varieties of rhododendrons. Plus, Joe Swift heads to Devon to find out about the design and planting challenges faced when creating a coastal garden.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The host enjoys an online conversation with Gregory Porter who, over the past decade, has brought jazz to the masses with his contemporary take, fast becoming one of the best-selling artists of the genre. Last year he launched podcast The Hang, which sees him chat to old and new friends from Jeff Goldblum to Annie Lennox and is planning to release his sixth album, All Rise, in August. Jools and Gregory discuss the artists he loves and is influenced by, illustrated with performances from the Later archive. The programme retains its focus on new music and artists, here spotlighting Dublin band Fontaines DC.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark presents a comprehensive analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a selection of memorable moments where members of the panel competed with each other to secure investment in a promising entrepreneur's product. Pitches featured include an umbrella dispensing machine which won the show's first ever investment, a travel toy company that all five panellists wanted a share of, and a commercial submarine business.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross create a peaceful, dewy-brown mountain scene featuring a fresh morning lake and succulent evergreens.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: An insight into the creative processes and cultural significance of traditional artefacts from the Pacific region, beginning with making of an Aboriginal didgeridoo.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The journalist examines the post-Thatcher years, considering the nation's final shift from an imperial power to an island at the heart of a strong world economy. He also recalls noteworthy developments under the leadership of John Major and Tony Blair, including Black Wednesday and the increasing awareness of global warming.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Autopsy: The Secret Story of Our Seas
programme.desc: Oceanographer Helen Czerski and zoologist George McGavin examine the health of the North Sea's ecosytem to reveal the startling changes the world's oceans are undergoing. They investigate the effects of high levels of life-threatening toxins on marine life, and the invisible plague of micro and nano plastics saturating the water, as well as a species of fungi that can potentially consume these microplastics. George also visits Utrecht University to see leading animal pathologist Lonneke Ijsseldijk perform a necropsy on a harbour porpoise to try to find out how and why it died.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Seven Ages of Britain
programme.desc: David Dimbleby tells the story of the power struggle between the monarchy and the Church during the Middle Ages through treasures of the period, and reveals how the code of chivalry brought the two sides together. He also reassesses the cultural impact of Richard II's reign, and examines artefacts including the Mappa Mundi, Chaucer's Canterbury Tales and Britain's only preserved medieval crown.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Renaissance
programme.desc: Art historian Dr James Fox celebrates an era from the early 1500s to the mid-1600s that saw Britain shed its medieval shackles and embrace a world of cutting-edge art, literature, architecture and science. In the opening edition, he explores how the Renaissance arrived on the nation's shores when a handful of influential European artists brought ideas from the continent in the early 16th century, sparking a cultural revolution.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross create a peaceful, dewy-brown mountain scene featuring a fresh morning lake and succulent evergreens.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: An insight into the creative processes and cultural significance of traditional artefacts from the Pacific region, beginning with making of an Aboriginal didgeridoo.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Autopsy: The Secret Story of Our Seas
programme.desc: Oceanographer Helen Czerski and zoologist George McGavin examine the health of the North Sea's ecosytem to reveal the startling changes the world's oceans are undergoing. They investigate the effects of high levels of life-threatening toxins on marine life, and the invisible plague of micro and nano plastics saturating the water, as well as a species of fungi that can potentially consume these microplastics. George also visits Utrecht University to see leading animal pathologist Lonneke Ijsseldijk perform a necropsy on a harbour porpoise to try to find out how and why it died.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a picture of a narrow and winding creek flowing slowly through a rocky meadow forest.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: One of the last traditional weavers on the Polynesian island of Rurutu creates a ceremonial taupoo - an ornate hat worn on special occasions - from dried pandanus leaves. Taking around five weeks to make, these hats were originally introduced to the island by British missionaries in the early 1800s, and now are worn to church and given as wedding gifts.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Killers
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb explores the hidden dangers of properties built in the Tudor period by looking at the new style of multi-room homes that only the aristocracy had previously been able to afford, which were now being constructed by the emerging wealthy classes. Plus, the presenter looks at the exotic new goods brought in from the New World by merchants that could actually be deadly.(n)

programme.title: Deep Ocean
programme.desc: Documentary about the first scientific research undertaken in a submersible in the Antarctic. Three marine biologists use customised UHD cameras to capture ling the extraordinary forms of life that thrive in the Southern Ocean on film. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Deep Ocean
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates a documentary following a crew attempting to film bioluminescent creatures in a huge underwater canyon in California's Monterey Bay.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrow's Worlds: The Unearthly History of Science Fiction
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook concludes his exploration of the genre by considering the allure of time travel, with the power to change the past or see the future being a theme that writers and film-makers have embraced for many years. From HG Wells' pioneering scientist in The Time Machine, to Doc and Marty McFly in Back to the Future, audiences have been presented with a host of colourful travellers and their machines. Featuring contributions by former Doctor Who stars David Tennant and Karen Gillan as well as current showrunner Steven Moffat, actor Christopher Lloyd and screenwriter Bob Gale (Back to the Future), Quantum Leap star Scott Bakula and The Time Traveler's Wife author Audrey Niffenegger.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Rembrandt
programme.desc: The story behind Rembrandt's most iconic work, The Night Watch. The events that surrounded the creation of his masterpiece contributed to a 10-year decline in his output, as he devoted his energies to a series of etchings inspired by his extra-marital affairs, while a struggle to manage his debts led him to declare bankruptcy.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a picture of a narrow and winding creek flowing slowly through a rocky meadow forest.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: One of the last traditional weavers on the Polynesian island of Rurutu creates a ceremonial taupoo - an ornate hat worn on special occasions - from dried pandanus leaves. Taking around five weeks to make, these hats were originally introduced to the island by British missionaries in the early 1800s, and now are worn to church and given as wedding gifts.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The journalist examines the post-Thatcher years, considering the nation's final shift from an imperial power to an island at the heart of a strong world economy. He also recalls noteworthy developments under the leadership of John Major and Tony Blair, including Black Wednesday and the increasing awareness of global warming.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross demonstrates how to create a deep forest with tall majestic trees, rain puddles and dark fresh air.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: With chainsaws, adzes and more than 30 different chisels, master Maori carver Logan Okiwi Shipgood crafts a beautiful 6ft tall 'pou' statue from native New Zealand timber.(n)

programme.title: Shock and Awe: The Story of Electricity
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili charts how scientists discovered the connection between electricity and magnetism, and explains why this breakthrough gave mankind far greater control over electrical forces. He also reveals that their findings were crucial to the development of electricity as a mass-produced source of power, leading to innovations in communications, manufacturing, transport and technology.(n)

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.(n)

programme.title: The Making of Spain
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore explores the history of Spain, beginning with the country's early years, when Iberia was a minor province of Carthage - then the most coveted of Rome's colonies - through to Spain's Muslim age and the Cordoba Caliphate.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: The High Art of the Low Countries
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores the countries of Holland and Belgium, famous for their tulips and windmills, but which were actually forged through conflict and division. He examines how a period of economic prosperity, driven by the secular middle class, led to the Dutch Golden Age of the 17th century, during which time the concept of oil painting was conceived, and the master painters such as Rembrandt and Vermeer found success.(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross demonstrates how to create a deep forest with tall majestic trees, rain puddles and dark fresh air.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: With chainsaws, adzes and more than 30 different chisels, master Maori carver Logan Okiwi Shipgood crafts a beautiful 6ft tall 'pou' statue from native New Zealand timber.(n)

programme.title: Shock and Awe: The Story of Electricity
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili charts how scientists discovered the connection between electricity and magnetism, and explains why this breakthrough gave mankind far greater control over electrical forces. He also reveals that their findings were crucial to the development of electricity as a mass-produced source of power, leading to innovations in communications, manufacturing, transport and technology.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross creates a trail covered in fresh white snow, surrounded by warm colours and fuzzy bark trees, as he paints a brisk quiet day.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: Following Hawaiian artist Dalani Tanahy as she creates a traditional hula skirt from tree bark, symbolising the resurgence of indigenous pride and identity.(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.(n)

programme.title: Madame Tussaud: A Legend in Wax
programme.desc: The story of the woman behind the worldwide waxworks empire, revealing how his single mother and entrepreneur travelled across the Channel to England, where she overcame the odds to establish her enduring brand. Determined to leave an account of who she was and the times she lived through, her memoirs, letters and papers offer a unique insight into the creation of the extraordinary empire that bears her name.(n)

programme.title: Chasing the Moon
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary about the space race recalls how the success of 1968's Apollo 8 mission led to underlying questions about the space programme from politicised young Americans - but Nasa pushed ahead regardless. Competition escalated among the training astronauts and at the beginning of 1969 the crew for Apollo 11 was announced - Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin and Michael Collins - and in mid-July crowds flooded Cocoa Beach in anticipation of the historic launch.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: In January 1961, the game of bingo turned into a multimillion-pound business almost overnight. This documentary explores how what started out as an occasional seaside flutter became the favoured pastime of nearly a quarter of the population, leading to moral panic about the dangers of easy prize-money. Narrated by Sarah Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: My Astonishing Self: Gabriel Byrne on George Bernard Shaw
programme.desc: The actor explores the life, works and passions of the playwright, examining Shaw's radical and unapologetic political thinking and ability to charm and satirise the establishment.(n)

programme.title: Fabric of Britain
programme.desc: Paul Martin explores the secret history of wallpaper, from lavish 17th-century offerings designed to look like embroidered textiles, through to the interior designs of the modern day. He reveals how 19th-century technological revolutions allowed designers such as Augustus Pugin and William Morris to correct Britain's poor reputation for decorative aesthetics, and explores how the UK's designers fought off the advance of the white-washed facades favoured by the likes of 20th-century modernist innovator Le Corbusier.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross creates a trail covered in fresh white snow, surrounded by warm colours and fuzzy bark trees, as he paints a brisk quiet day.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in the Pacific
programme.desc: Following Hawaiian artist Dalani Tanahy as she creates a traditional hula skirt from tree bark, symbolising the resurgence of indigenous pride and identity.(n)

programme.title: Madame Tussaud: A Legend in Wax
programme.desc: The story of the woman behind the worldwide waxworks empire, revealing how his single mother and entrepreneur travelled across the Channel to England, where she overcame the odds to establish her enduring brand. Determined to leave an account of who she was and the times she lived through, her memoirs, letters and papers offer a unique insight into the creation of the extraordinary empire that bears her name.(n)

programme.title: Benjamin Britten on Camera
programme.desc: Britten was one of the great classical composers of the broadcasting age and his music was regularly performed on radio and TV throughout his working life. This documentary outlines his broadcasting legacy by meeting some of the musicians he wrote for, visiting the Suffolk coast that inspired so much of his work, and hearing from the producers who brought his music to millions. With contributions by David Attenborough, Michael Crawford, Humphrey Burton and soprano April Cantelo. Narrated by James Naughtie.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Gary Davies hosts the edition first shown on October 12, featuring performances by Sinitta, Cliff Richard, Alice Cooper, Deborah Harry, Chris Rea, Richard Marx and Living in a Box.(n)

programme.title: Kermode and Mayo's Home Entertainment Service
programme.desc: With cinemas closed and the nation in lockdown, the UK's most-trusted screen-guides turn their attention from the big screen to the small screen for the first time. Broadcast from Mark and Simon's respective homes, the duo turn their attention to new sci-fi thriller series Snowpiercer, just out on Netflix, while popping in for a chat is actor Rafe Spall, currently appearing in Trying on Apple TV+.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989

programme.title: The Beatles: Made on Merseyside
programme.desc: Few dispute that the Beatles defined 1960s music and popular culture like no other band, but how John, Paul, George and Ringo made the journey from Merseyside teenagers to international pop stars is less known. Director Alan Byron's documentary recounts the rise of the band as American rock 'n' roll and rhythm and blues dragged post-war Liverpool into one of the most vibrant music cities ever with the Mersey Beat sound.(n)

programme.title: Sings the Beatles
programme.desc: A look back through the BBC's archives at memorable covers of classic Beatles songs. Included are a performance of Day Tripper by Sandie Shaw, Shirley Bassey's version of Something, the Carpenters' rendition of Help!, Oasis's reinvention of I Am the Walrus, and Joe Cocker's chart-topping interpretation of With a Little Help from My Friends. Plus, Paul McCartney's solo performance of Lady Madonna.(n)

In London, Kirstie helps first time buyers Emily and Dustin who are desperate get on the property ladder after spending a year living with Emily's parents as they save up for a deposit. Meanwhile in Hertfordshire, Phil tries to find home for three generations of females moving out of London.(n)

programme.title: Murder in the Outback: The Falconio and Lees Mystery
programme.desc: Documentary examining the killing of British tourist Peter Falconio in Australia's Northern Territory in July 2001, exploring the details and questions that surround this infamous case. The concluding episode examines how DNA found on Joanne Lees' shirt and the couple's Kombi van were decisive in the murder trial of Bradley Murdoch, but even with this evidence, there are serious questions still to be answered in this controversial case.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the popular words-and-numbers quiz, as Sean Lock and Claudia Winkleman take on Jon Richardson and Henning Wehn. Lexicographer Susie Dent is joined by Nick Helm to adjudicate in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, some of Britain's best loved personalities, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on what they have been watching during the week.(n)

programme.title: Joe Lycett's Got Your Back
programme.desc: The comedian becomes the people's champion in an offbeat show investigating buyers' rights and fighting for justice. In this edition, Joe takes a very special look back at the series, featuring behind-the-scenes insights, never-before-seen moments, and his most outrageous victories to date.(n)

programme.title: Murder in the Outback: The Falconio and Lees Mystery
programme.desc: In the third episode, former criminal defence lawyer Andrew Fraser questions the verdict of the murder trial, that saw Bradley Murdoch found guilty of murder. The programme examines other potential suspects, including an eyewitness account of a couple talking to a man who matched the police description of the killer, as well as considering theories that Falconio is still alive, since his body was never found and several people have reported encountering him.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro, to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Market trader Russell and retired nurse Nicola kick-off proceedings in Essex and the evening seems to go well with one diner polishing off his own food - and everyone else's. The second night sees proud parents Sophie and Elliot host, but their guests find crab claws in their starter. On the third evening romantic duo Gemma and Glen decide to go for a more refined dining experience in the hope of winning the cash prize of £1,000. However, it's Gemma's love for burlesque that grabs most attention.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Parent
programme.desc: Anita Rani hosts as families with differing parenting styles compete against one another. Those taking part in this episode include Hannah, who takes a parent-centric approach to bringing up her son, believing that putting parents' needs first will ultimately teach children to become independent and prepare them for adult life. Also competing are Mia and Adam, whose attachment parenting ethos means they prioritise the needs and desires of their daughter and son over their own. Completing this line-up are Nicky and David, who champion a strict parenting style over their three children.(n)

programme.title: Car S.O.S

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: An entrepreneur leaves his pet in Rebecca's apparently capable hands, but Sam jeopardises her job by letting it escape. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley.(n)

programme.title: Cheers

programme.desc: Niles and Daphne plan a natural birth, causing the father-to-be to develop sympathy pains. Meanwhile, Frasier hires a professional matchmaker - but ends up going on a string of bad dates. Guest starring Laura Linney.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Parent
programme.desc: Home-educators Becky and Ben believe that for their three daughters - aged 10, eight and five - learning should not just happen in a classroom but all the time, regardless of location. They go up against Richard and Emily, who follow a regimented parenting style based on a meticulous routine, which includes daily training on a running machine and music lessons for their sons, aged six and five. Completing this week's line up are Andi and Jon, who employ a 'structured chaos' approach to bringing up their two sets of twins, aged six and three, and a son aged four. Presented by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.desc: A look back at some of the series' most memorable and dynamic dates - reliving the moments of nerves, awkwardness, naughtiness and passion, and of unlikely chemistry, roaring rivalries and heart-warming stories. The show also reveals what the daters are up to now - featuring chicken farmer Griff, Perry in his gold lamé trunks, and Robyn, whose love mantra is 'treat 'em mean and keep 'em keen'. London ladette Lauren is about to have the shock of her life, while double-daters, best friends and fashionistas Sara and Jo head off in search of something a bit more meaningful.(n)

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: Documentary portrait of soul, jazz and R'n'B singer-songwriter Amy Winehouse, whose untimely death in July 2011 followed a well-publicised history of drugs and alcohol abuse. Director Asif Kapadia traces Amy's rise and demise over the 13 years preceding her death, telling her story via her music and autobiographical song lyrics, video footage shot by friends and family, archive television clips, plus voiceover interviews with those who were personally and professionally close to her. Contributors include Pete Doherty, Mitch Winehouse, Tony Bennett, Mark Ronson and Tyler James.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News

Behind closed doors at Cadbury's Bournville plant, a team of scientists struggles to meet the biggest challenge the company has faced for a century - to dramatically cut sugar from its Dairy Milk recipe. In the first episode, missing for nearly 20 years, drunken scientist Rick arrives on his daughter Beth's doorstep looking to move in, but her husband Jerry isn't too thrilled. Rick converts the garage into his laboratory and involves easily influenced grandson Morty in his insane misadventures, starting with a mission to another dimension to find the seeds to mega-trees.(n)

When Tracy 'accidentally' meets Jared and they fall in love, Ashley is comforted to see her mother happy, until Jared moves in and begins doing whatever he can do to shut her out of their new life. It quickly becomes apparent that Jared's hold on Tracy could lead to devastating consequences. Thriller, starring Chris Johnson, Jennifer Lafleur and Addy Stafford.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: New Zealand's Northern Explorer, the longest-running passenger service in the country. The train travels 423 miles along the historic North Island Main Trunk Line on a 12-hour voyage and the journey takes travellers through some of the most astonishing landscapes of the southern hemisphere from volcanoes to coast and from lava fields to unspoilt islands. Historians explain the history of the railway and tell the tale of the terrible tragedy at Tangiwai, when over 150 people were killed by a volcanic mudflow that hit the train. Narrated by Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb investigates the origins of the obsession for mass witch-hunts and trials that swept the British Isles during the 17th century. Travelling to Scotland and Denmark, she challenges the accepted wisdom that King James VI of Scotland, later James I of England, was responsible for stirring up the hysteria. She also tells the story of Scotland's first mass witch trial in 1590 and the infamous Pendle witch trials towards the end of his reign.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Factories
programme.desc: Behind the doors of the Heinz factory in Wigan, where 850 people work around the clock to produce 200 different products, including soup, pasta and, of course, 450 millions of cans of baked beans every year. The documentary discovers the secrets of making food on this scale, meets workers including food tasters, apprentice engineers and the factory's own firemen, and also learns the story behind the famous Heinz 57 number.(n)

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels 1,500 miles in a journey from Cape Town in South Africa to the Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe, following a hugely ambitious railway pioneered by 19th-century British colonial politician Cecil Rhodes. He starts his trip in luxury on the Blue Train, a five-star hotel on rails that takes him to the mining town of Kimberley, where he explores the diamond mine where Rhodes made his fortune.(n)

programme.title: Witches: A Century of Murder
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb's investigation into the notorious 17th-century witch trials concludes with a profile of Matthew Hopkins, the opportunistic puritan witch-hunter who transformed paranoia about Satanism into a lucrative business as he hanged hundreds of people for crimes they could not possibly have committed. Making use of contemporary reports, Suzannah paints a portrait of a man who believed he could cross any boundary and break any law to achieve his goals. Naming himself 'Witchfinder General', Hopkins toured the country charging fees for his services, but Suzannah's research reveals that ultimately, the public's distaste for witches was not as strong as its hatred of being conned by charlatans. Hopkins would eventually die of tuberculosis in relative obscurity, but his malign legacy lived on across the Atlantic, as witch-hunts began in Salem, Massachusetts.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Steam Train Museum
programme.desc: Phil and Stuart go to huge efforts decorating the site with home-made pumpkin-scarecrows, graveyards and mummies in preparation for Halloween. Brian cooks breakfast on a shovel for the engine drivers and John tells ghost stories from the fairground. As the event gets under way, the museum's enthusiastic volunteers dress up in costume to scare the public on the ghost train, while retired minister David entertains the passengers on the journey.(n)

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: The station shuts for four days over the Christmas holidays, though staff are still needed on site as they face the disruption of track and engineering works. Up the line at Oxford, workers are laying a whole new track system. Luckily, they have the Kirow Crane to help them - a multi-million-pound lifting machine that can lay over 100 tonnes of track at a time. At Swindon, specialists work to install 30 new booms to support the overhead lines for a new generation of electric trains. Weighing up to 15 tonnes, they need to be carefully lifted into place. However, bad weather threatens progress.(n)

programme.title: Dan Snow: The Tutankhamun Mystery
programme.desc: The historian explores the story of the Egyptian pharaoh's life and death. He encounters the mummies of the boy king's parents in Cairo, investigates an injury the pharaoh sustained towards the end of his life - an injury that would eventually result in his death - and explores why images of the king look more like a woman.(n)

programme.title: Ancient Mysteries
programme.desc: A look at what caused the downfall of the Ancient Egyptians in 30BC, with new evidence revealing a cataclysmic event that shook the world and sowed the seeds of the empire's demise. Egyptologist Joe Manning and climate historian Francis Ludlow have traced this misfortune to an event in 44BC, when a colossal volcano erupted somewhere in the Tropics.(n)

programme.title: Draining the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the infamous disappearances of ships and aircraft, adopting the rather unorthodox technique of exploring the area's ominous reputation by 'draining the water from it' to see what exactly lies below the surface of the mythical triangle. Data from sophisticated sonar surveys enables the ocean floor to be seen, revealing strange geological features. The programme then contemplates whether they have had any influence on the mysterious occurrences that have been documented over the years.(n)

programme.title: The 21.co.uk Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Factories
programme.desc: Behind the doors of the Heinz factory in Wigan, where 850 people work around the clock to produce 200 different products, including soup, pasta and, of course, 450 millions of cans of baked beans every year. The documentary discovers the secrets of making food on this scale, meets workers including food tasters, apprentice engineers and the factory's own firemen, and also learns the story behind the famous Heinz 57 number.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell sets out on a journey to discover how six of Britain's most stunning bridges were designed and built. Completed in 1890, the Forth Rail Bridge now carries around 200 trains every day. The last of the great Victorian engineering triumphs, it has grown to symbolise Scotland as much as Edinburgh Castle, bagpipes or kilts. But, as Rob learns, this incredible engineering achievement was born from the tragedy of the 1879 Tay Bridge disaster, and 73 deaths were connected with its construction and immediate aftermath.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice tackles a three-bedroom terraced Victorian house in Norwich which, thanks to a vast array of deeply personal belongings, overpowering paintwork and too much furniture, has been languishing on the market for three months. A few coats of paint to neutralise the colour scheme, some effective storage ideas and a ruthless purge of useless items certainly impress the owner.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Jon Bentley takes Google's latest laptop - the Pixelbook Go - on a day's work experience at one of the world's foremost news websites, the Mail Online. The G Team assists some NHS nurses who want to see how gadgets can get them improve their sleep patterns when working night shifts. Plus, Craig Charles attempts to turn a house into a smart home using off-the-shelf DIY kits and Georgie Barrat hunts down the must-haves for 2020 at the CES exhibition in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: A 600-mile journey through one of the most world's most northern countries - Finland - from Helsinki in the south to Kemijärvi in Finnish Lapland. The line whisks passengers through the thickest of forests, past vast frozen lakes 63 times the size of Lake Windermere and to station stops where time has stood still. As the train enters the Arctic Circle, it calls at Rovaniemi, a place destroyed by German soldiers at the end of the Second World War. Now the town has been re-built, famously in the shape of a reindeer, serving as the official home of Santa Claus. Narrated by Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: A Greek Odyssey with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: The historian and classicist explores Greece from the time of the Ancients up to the present day. She begins by exploring a graveyard of ancient shipwrecks in the waters of the Eastern Mediterranean, then enjoys the tradition of a warm welcome on the island of Chios. Next, Bettany heads to the island of Lesbos, visiting the ancient Greek Theatre of Mytilene and taking a dip in the island's thermal waters. Finally, Bettany stops on Samos, an island known for both its ancient naval power and its famous sixth-century BC resident, mathematician and philosopher - Pythagoras.(n)

programme.title: When... Goes Horribly Wrong
